SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

lotus.domino
Interface RichTextParagraphStyle

All Superinterfaces:
Base
public interface RichTextParagraphStyle
extends Base

Represents rich text paragraph attributes.

Containment

Contained by: Session

Contains: RichTextTab

Creation and access

To create a new RichTextParagraphStyle object, use createRichTextParagraphStyle in Session.

Use a RichTextParagraphStyle object with appendParagraphStyle of RichTextItem. Text that follows a rich text paragraph style assumes the attributes of the rich text paragraph style.

See Also

Example

getAlignment

int getAlignment()
                 throws NotesException
Read-Write. Horizontal alignment of text in each paragraph.

Legal values

  • RichTextParagraphStyle.ALIGN_CENTER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.ALIGN_FULL
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.ALIGN_LEFT
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.ALIGN_NOWRAP
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.ALIGN_RIGHT

getLeftMargin

int getLeftMargin()
                  throws NotesException
Read-Write. Left margin of each line except the first in each paragraph.

Legal values

The following constants are available:

  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_INCH

The unit of measure used by the above constants is a "twip," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips. You can apply arithmetic to the constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75 for three-quarters of an inch.

See Also

Examples: Working with text in Java classes

Throws:
NotesException

getTabs

java.util.Vector getTabs()
                         throws NotesException
Read-only. Tabs in a rich text paragraph style.

Return value

java.util.Vector

A vector of RichTextTab elements representing the tabs in the rich text paragraph style.

Usage

See RichTextTab for additional information and an example.

See Also

Working with text in Java classes

Throws:
NotesException

setTab

void setTab(int arg1,
            int arg2)
            throws NotesException
Sets a tab in a rich text paragraph style.

Parameters

int position

Position of the tab. The following constants are available:

  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_INCH

The unit of measure used by the above constants is a "twip," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips. You can apply arithmetic to the constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75 for three-quarters of an inch.

int type
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_CENTER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_DECIMAL
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_LEFT
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_RIGHT

Usage

See RichTextTab for additional information and an example.

You can apply arithmetic to the position constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or (int)(RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75) for three-quarters of an inch. The actual int value is in "twips," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips.

See Also

Working with text in Java classes

Throws:
NotesException

setTabs

void setTabs(int arg1,
             int arg2,
             int arg3,
             int arg4)
             throws NotesException
Sets tabs at even intervals in a rich text paragraph style.

Parameters

int count

Number of tabs to be set.

int startpos

Position of the first tab. The following constants are available:

  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_INCH

The unit of measure used by the above constants is a "twip," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips. You can apply arithmetic to the constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75 for three-quarters of an inch.

int interval

Interval between tabs. The following constants are available:

  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_INCH

The unit of measure used by the above constants is a "twip," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips. You can apply arithmetic to the constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75 for three-quarters of an inch.

int type
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_CENTER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_DECIMAL
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_LEFT
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_RIGHT

Usage

See RichTextTab for additional information and an example.

You can apply arithmetic to the position and interval constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or (int)(RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75) for three-quarters of an inch. The actual int value is in "twips," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips.

See Also

Sets tabs at even intervals in a rich text paragraph style.

Parameters

int count

Number of tabs to be set.

int startpos

Position of the first tab. The following constants are available:

  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_INCH

The unit of measure used by the above constants is a "twip," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips. You can apply arithmetic to the constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75 for three-quarters of an inch.

int interval

Interval between tabs. The following constants are available:

  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.RULER_ONE_INCH

The unit of measure used by the above constants is a "twip," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips. You can apply arithmetic to the constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75 for three-quarters of an inch.

int type
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_CENTER
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_DECIMAL
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_LEFT
  • RichTextParagraphStyle.TAB_RIGHT

Usage

See RichTextTab for additional information and an example.

You can apply arithmetic to the position and interval constants to obtain other measurements. For example, RULER_ONE_CENTIMETER * 2 for two centimeters or (int)(RULER_ONE_INCH * 0.75) for three-quarters of an inch. The actual int value is in "twips," where one centimeter is 567 twips and one inch is 1440 twips.

Throws:
NotesException

recycle

void recycle(java.util.Vector arg1)
             throws NotesException
The recycle method unconditionally destroys an object and returns its memory to the system.

All lotus.domino classes contain the following methods:

public void recycle()
public void recycle(java.util.Vector objects)

In the latter method, the vector contains the Domino Objects to be recycled. This method effectively batches recycle operations and is especially efficient for remote (IIOP) calls.

Java has no knowlege of the heavyweight back-end Domino Objects, only the lightweight Java objects representing them. Garbage collection has no effect on Domino Objects unless you first explicitly recycle them.

If you appear to have memory problems, try recycle but adhere to the following guidelines:

  • Recycle an object only if it is no longer needed.
  • Recycle an object in the same thread in which it is created.
  • Recycling a parent recycles all the children.
  • In Session, call recycle() only after all other threads exit.
  • Where NotesThread.sinitThread() and NotesThread.stermThread() are used, call recycle() before stermThread.

Loops enumerating documents or items are good candidates for recycling.

In a remote (IIOP) environment, recycle releases resources on the server. Although a client-side cache exists, the Java object can no longer communicate with its remote counterpart.

In a remote (IIOP) environment, recycle can be called from any thread on any object.

If you create more than one object to represent the same Domino element, recycling one recycles all. For example:

View v1 = db.getView("All");
View v2 = db.getView("All");
v1.recycle(); // also recycles v2

Results are undefined if you attempt to use a recycled object. No error is guaranteed.

See Also

Supporting components

Specified by:
recycle in interface Base
Throws:
NotesException

recycle

void recycle()
             throws NotesException
